item.title: What is the salary of Apple's new Indian-origin CFO Kevan Parekh? Details here - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Apple's New CFO Kevan Parekh: Salary and Background Details

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the appointment of Kevan Parekh as the new Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of Apple Inc., effective January 1, 2025, along with details of his salary and professional background.

  • Kevan Parekh's annual salary is set at $1 million (₹8.57 crore).
  • Parekh joined Apple in June 2013 and held previous roles in financial planning and analysis.
  • He succeeds Luca Maestri as part of a planned transition.
  • Parekh has extensive experience with Thomson Reuters and General Motors.
  • Apple's CEO Tim Cook praised Parekh's intellect and judgment in his appointment announcement.
“For more than a decade, Kevan has been an indispensable member of Apple's finance leadership team...” - Tim Cook

Parekh's leadership is expected to steer Apple's financial strategies effectively as he steps into this significant role.

item.title: Etihad Airways flight aborts takeoff at Melbourne airport after tyre burst, passengers evacuated safely - The Times of India
item.description:
Etihad Airways Flight Abort Soaring at Melbourne Airport Due to Tyre Burst

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

An Etihad Airways flight had to abort its takeoff at Melbourne Airport after experiencing a tyre burst, leading to the safe evacuation of passengers.

  • The incident occurred during takeoff.
  • All passengers were evacuated safely without injury.
  • The flight's safety protocols were effectively executed.
“Safety is our top priority and our team acted quickly to ensure all passengers were unharmed.”

The swift action taken ensured the safety of all onboard, highlighting the importance of aircraft safety measures.

item.title: Petrol Pump booked for delivering deficit fuel to consumers in Anantnag - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Petrol Pump in Anantnag Penalized for Deficient Fuel Delivery

Date: Jan 05, 2023 Source: Greater Kashmir

A petrol pump on National Highway Anantnag has been booked for delivering less fuel to consumers following a surprise inspection by the Enforcement unit of Legal Metrology Anantnag.

  • The inspection revealed that every 5 litres delivered was short by 30 ml.
  • The display boards at the petrol pump were found to be inaccurate.
  • The nozzle was seized, and prosecution under the Legal Metrology Act has begun against the pump owner.
  • Consumers are encouraged to check fuel delivery using a verified 5 litre measure, which should be visible at all petrol pumps.
  • Consumer rights awareness was promoted in the local community, with a toll-free number provided for complaints.
“Accuracy in the quantity of goods or fuel is the basic right of consumers.”

Consumers in the area appreciated the enforcement action and have been informed about their rights to ensure fair delivery of fuel.

item.title: HDFC Bank's LDR falls below 100% for the first time after merger - Business Standard
item.description:
HDFC Bank's Loan-to-Deposit Ratio Drops Below 100% for the First Time Post-Merger

Date: Jan 05 2025 | Source: Business Standard

HDFC Bank's loan-to-deposit ratio (LDR) has fallen below 100% for the first time since its merger with HDFC Ltd. This decline is attributed to slower loan growth and the securitisation of a significant portion of loans in Q3 of FY25.

  • HDFC Bank’s LDR is now at 99.2%, down from 100.76% in Q2 of FY25.
  • The LDR was 111.53% in Q3 of 2023-24.
  • The decrease is in line with the bank’s guidance for more cautious loan growth.
"The easing of the LDR aligns with the bank’s guidance, which indicated that it would grow its loan book more cautiously."

This drop below the critical 100% mark signifies a strategic shift in HDFC Bank’s approach to lending post-merger.

item.title: Earning Rs 48 crore per day, Indian-origin techie is world's highest paid person - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Indian-Origin Techie Jagdeep Singh Earns Rs 48 Crore Per Day

Published: 05 January 2025, 12:47 IST

This article highlights the astonishing earnings of Jagdeep Singh, who has become the highest-paid employee in the world with a daily income of Rs 48 crore. His achievements and career trajectory are also outlined.

  • Jagdeep Singh's annual salary is Rs 17,500 crore.
  • He is a founder of QuantumScape, an electric vehicle battery company.
  • Singh's daily earnings surpass the annual revenues of many large companies.
  • He previously worked at Hewlett-Packard and Sun Microsystems.
  • Singh has a BTech from Stanford University and an MBA from UC Berkeley.
  • QuantumScape focuses on solid-state battery technology for electric vehicles.
  • In February 2023, Singh stepped down as CEO of QuantumScape but continues as Chairman of the Board.
"His daily wage is greater than the annual revenue of many prominent companies."

Jagdeep Singh's remarkable financial success highlights the potential of innovative technology in transforming industries.

item.title: 3 Revolutionary Products Set to Launch in 2025! - MotorOctane
item.description:
3 Revolutionary Products Set to Launch in 2025!

Date: TBD | Source: MotorOctane

2025 is expected to be a revolutionary year for the Indian automotive space, with new petrol, CNG, ethanol, and EVs launching. Here are three unique cars launching in 2025.

  • Vayve Eva: A new electric quadricycle with a claimed range of 250 km and rooftop solar panels.
  • Hero Surge S32 Electric: An innovative scooter-three-wheeler concept designed for last-mile mobility.
  • Ligier Myli: A budget EV with a rumored range of up to 192 km.
“Which of these 3 models are you most excited for?”

This year promises to bring significant changes in the automotive market with these innovative launches aiming to reshape mobility.

item.title: NTPC Green Energy Share Price: 1000MW solar project from UPPCL! Time to BUY shares? Check target - ET Now
item.description:
NTPC Green Energy's 1000MW Solar Project: A Strong Investment Opportunity?

Updated: January 5, 2025 | Source: ET NOW News

NTPC Renewable Energy Limited has emerged as a successful bidder for a 1000 MW solar power project, securing a competitive tariff while awaiting the letter of award from UPPCL.

  • NTPC REL secured a capacity of 1000 MW at Rs 2.56/kWh.
  • Share price closed at Rs 128.35, showing a 0.35% increase on the BSE.
  • NTPC Renewable Energy began commercial delivery of 30 MW from its 150 MW solar plant in Gujarat.
"The market expert has given a BUY rating to the stock, with a target range of Rs 134-Rs 139 at the stop loss of Rs 120."

This significant project highlights NTPC's commitment to renewable energy and presents a promising investment opportunity in the changing energy landscape.

item.title: Stocks to buy under ₹100: Sumeet Bagadia recommends three shares to buy tomorrow — 6 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stocks to buy under ₹100: Sumeet Bagadia recommends three shares to buy tomorrow — 6 January 2025

Date: 6 January 2025

Source: Live Mint

The domestic stock market faced significant losses on 3 January due to profit booking, but remains cautiously optimistic according to stock analyst Sumeet Bagadia. Despite the drop, the Nifty 50 index sustained above important support levels.

Sumeet Bagadia's stock recommendations

  • South Indian Bank Ltd. (SOUTHBANK): Buy at ₹26.96; Target at ₹29; Stop Loss at ₹26.
  • Lloyds Engineering Works Ltd. (LLOYDSENGG): Buy at ₹85.29; Target at ₹92; Stop Loss at ₹82.
  • Paramount Communications Ltd. (PARACABLES): Buy at ₹85.1; Target at ₹91; Stop Loss at ₹82.5.
“Despite a heavy sell-off on Friday, the Indian stock market bias is cautiously optimistic.” - Sumeet Bagadia

Investors are advised to consult certified experts before making investment decisions.

item.title: Foreign investors pull out Rs 4,285 crore from Indian equities amid high valuations, global headwinds - The Times of India
item.description:
Foreign Investors Withdraw ₹4,285 Crore from Indian Equities Amid High Valuations and Global Challenges

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Foreign investors have pulled out ₹4,285 crore from Indian equities due to high valuations and global headwinds, reflecting a significant shift in market dynamics.

  • The outflow is attributed to rising global inflation and interest rates.
  • Investors are concerned about the sustainability of high valuations in Indian markets.
  • This marks a notable trend of foreign exit amidst a generally bullish domestic market.
  • Experts warn that continued outflows could impact market stability.
"The current environment of high valuations combined with global uncertainties is making foreign investors cautious," an analyst noted.

This trend indicates a need for the Indian market to reassess its positioning in the face of global financial challenges.

item.title: New York imposes first ever congestion pricing plan in US.. - Greatandhra
item.description:
New York Implements First Congestion Pricing Plan in the US

Publication Date: Date Not Specified Source: Xinhua News Agency

A congestion pricing plan has been initiated in Manhattan, making New York City the first in the United States to adopt such a system.

  • Vehicles entering the congestion relief zone will be tolled based on vehicle type, time of day, and payment method.
  • This plan aims to reduce the number of vehicles in the zone by an estimated 10%.
  • The Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) anticipates generating $1 billion annually from this plan.
  • Controversy surrounding the plan has resulted in multiple lawsuits, though implementation proceeded.
"The tolls would be adjusted upward in 2028 and 2031, phasing out 40% of initial discounts."

This congestion pricing initiative marks a significant shift in urban traffic management and aims to fund public transportation while reducing congestion in Manhattan.

item.title: AI to companies is like fridge to Coca-Cola — Investor Vijay Kedia shares interesting analogy | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
AI to Companies is Like Fridge to Coca-Cola — Investor Vijay Kedia Shares Interesting Analogy

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: Live Mint

In a recent post, stock market investor Vijay Kedia likened the impact of artificial intelligence (AI) on companies to the transformative effect of refrigerators on the beverage industry, particularly on Pepsi and Coca-Cola.

  • Kedia stated that AI will enable users to innovate and benefit from the technology revolution, similar to how refrigerators benefited the beverage giants.
  • He emphasized that every company should adopt AI as a tool to enhance efficiency without necessarily developing their own software.
  • Social media reactions have supported Kedia's perspective on AI's widespread relevance and importance.
“Just as the invention of fridges enabled Pepsi and Coca-Cola to dominate globally, AI will empower users to create and innovate. The true beneficiaries of AI will be those who harness its potential, not just the developers.” — Vijay Kedia

In conclusion, Kedia's analogy offers insight into the potential of AI for businesses, stressing that like refrigerators, AI can drive competitiveness and growth in various sectors.

item.title: Govt to launch another round of PLI scheme for steel sector on Monday - Business Standard
item.description:
Govt to Launch New Round of PLI Scheme for Steel Sector

Publication Date: January 6, 2024

Source: Steel Ministry Statement

The government will launch ‘PLI scheme 1.1’ aimed at boosting domestic production of specialty steel and reducing imports.

  • The steel minister, H D Kumaraswamy, will announce the scheme.
  • The initiative seeks to draw in capital investments to enhance domestic manufacture of specialty steel.
  • Investments worth Rs 27,106 crore have already been attracted, with an anticipated production of 7.90 million tonnes.
  • The scheme aims to create 14,760 direct jobs.
  • Government feedback indicated the need for a second round of the PLI scheme to increase participation.
  • Specialty steel is crucial for industries such as defense and automotive.
The concept of Production-Linked Incentives (PLI) was conceived during the Covid-induced global lockdowns of 2020.

The launch of the new round of the PLI scheme reflects the government's commitment to enhancing domestic manufacturing and addressing the shortcomings of the initial effort.

item.title: ITC Hotels demerger on January 6: Here's all you need to know - CNBCTV18
item.description:
ITC Hotels demerger on January 6: Here's all you need to know

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

ITC Hotels is set for a demerger on January 6, marking a significant restructuring for the company, allowing shareholders to receive shares directly in the hotel business.

  • ITC will retain a 40% stake in its hotel business, with shareholders receiving one ITC Hotels share for every 10 ITC shares owned.
  • ITC Hotels represents 4% of ITC’s total revenue and 2.5% of EBIT, yet accounts for 14% of total assets.
  • Post-pandemic growth: H1FY25 revenue of ₹1,471 crore with EBITDA margins at 28%.
  • Future projections indicate revenues could reach ₹3,680 crore by FY25 and ₹4,400 crore by FY26.
  • Expected trading valuation for ITC Hotels between ₹175 and ₹190 upon independent listing.
Shareholders' stake valued at ₹22,000-23,750 crore, translating to an added value of ₹17-19 per ITC share.

This demerger is anticipated to enhance ITC's overall return on capital, with significant growth potential ahead for ITC Hotels.

item.title: ITC-ITC Hotels Demerger: Share price, listing date, F&O contracts - Things to know before Jan 6 record date - ET Now
item.description:
ITC-ITC Hotels Demerger: Share price, listing date, F&O contracts - Things to know before Jan 6 record date

Updated: January 5, 2025

The highly anticipated demerger of ITC Hotels from ITC Limited will take place on January 6, 2025, determining the eligibility for shareholders to receive shares of the newly formed entity.

  • ITC will retain 40% ownership while distributing 60% to existing shareholders.
  • Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares held in ITC.
  • The stock is expected to list on NSE and BSE within 60 days of receiving the NCLT order dated December 16, 2024.
  • Market valuation of ITC Hotels is estimated between Rs 42,500 to Rs 62,000 crore.
  • ITC F&O contracts will be introduced again on January 6, 2025.
"We believe the listing of ITC Hotels shares will be in the range of Rs 200-300 per share at a market cap of Rs 42,500-62,000 crore." - Mihir P Shah, Nomura

This demerger is crucial as it is expected to unlock significant shareholder value and allow focused growth in the luxury hospitality sector.

item.title: FPIs withdraw ₹4,285 crore in 3 trading sessions amid high valuations, global headwinds | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
FPIs Withdraw ₹4,285 Crore in 3 Trading Sessions Amid High Valuations, Global Headwinds

Publication Date: January 3, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

In the first three trading days of January, foreign investors withdrew ₹4,285 crore from Indian equities amidst concerns over upcoming earnings and high stock valuations. This marks a significant trend away from Indian investments following a net inflow of ₹15,446 crore in December.

  • Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) pulled out ₹4,285 crore during January 1-3.
  • Investor sentiment is cautious due to a strong dollar and high US bond yields.
  • FPIs are reassessing investments ahead of the Q3FY25 earnings season.
  • The depreciating rupee is impacting the attractiveness of Indian equities.
  • Net inflows for 2024 stand at only ₹427 crore, a stark contrast to the ₹1.71 lakh crore in 2023.
"FPIs selling is due to high valuations in the secondary market... in the primary market where the valuations are fair, FPIs have been sustained investors." - V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services

The outflows highlight a cautious stance from foreign investors, reflecting broader economic concerns and valuation challenges in the Indian market.

item.title: Big Shock For Hyundai Creta? - MotorOctane
item.description:
December 2024 Car Sales: Key Highlights and Trends

Date: December 2024 | Source: MotorOctane

As 2024 comes to a close, car manufacturers are offering significant discounts while reviewing their best-sold models. December saw impressive sales figures across several brands.

  • Maruti Brezza: Topped the sales with 17,300 units, compared to 12,844 last year.
  • Maruti WagonR: Sold 17,300 units, a constant favorite in the hatchback segment.
  • Maruti Dzire: Returned to the top-10 list with 16,573 units sold.
  • Hyundai Creta: Sold over 12,600 units, maintaining its position in the market.
  • Mahindra Scorpio: The only proper SUV in the list with over 12,100 units sold.
Maruti Brezza achieved over 17,300 units in December.

This month highlights the competitive landscape of the automotive market, with several familiar names leading the charts.

item.title: Hyundai Creta Electric unveiled: All you need to know - CarWale
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric unveiled: All you need to know

Publication Date: January 17, 2025

Source: CarWale

After months of anticipation, the Hyundai Creta Electric has been revealed, marking the South Korean automaker’s first locally made SUV.

  • The Creta Electric will offer two battery pack options: a 42kWh pack with a range of 390km and a 51.4kWh pack with a range of 473km.
  • Charging times are 58 minutes with a DC fast charger and four hours with an 11kWh AC wall box charger.
  • It will be available in four variants: Executive, Smart, Premium, and Excellence.
  • Design cues are taken from the regular Creta with specific enhancements for the electric model.
  • Inside, expect advanced features akin to the ICE version including dual digital displays, ADAS, and a panoramic sunroof.
  • Pricing is expected to be between Rs. 22 lakh to Rs. 26 lakh.
“The Creta Electric is now a large piece of the puzzle that has been revealed, this puzzle being a new electric SUV D-segment battle.”

In conclusion, the Hyundai Creta Electric represents a significant step in the electric SUV market, promising innovative technology and competitive pricing.

item.title: Mcap of 4 of top-10 most valued firms fall by ₹96,606 crore; HDFC Bank biggest hit | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Mcap of 4 of top-10 most valued firms fall by ₹96,606 crore; HDFC Bank biggest hit

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The combined market capitalisation of four of the top 10 most valuable companies in India saw a decline last week, with HDFC Bank experiencing the largest drop.

  • The overall market cap decline amounted to ₹96,605.66 crore.
  • HDFC Bank's valuation decreased by ₹37,025.46 crore to ₹13,37,919.84 crore.
  • ICICI Bank's valuation fell by ₹29,324.55 crore to ₹8,93,378.50 crore.
  • Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) saw a decline of ₹24,856.26 crore to ₹14,83,144.53 crore.
  • State Bank of India lost ₹5,399.39 crore, reducing its valuation to ₹7,08,168.60 crore.
  • In contrast, Reliance Industries gained ₹41,138.41 crore, becoming more valuable at ₹16,93,373.48 crore.
  • Other companies like Hindustan Unilever and LIC also recorded gains in their market valuations.
“During the same period, the BSE benchmark index climbed 524.04 points (0.66%).”

While four firms struggled, several others managed to increase their market capitalisation, showing mixed fortunes in the stock market.

item.title: Nayara Energy to expand retail network by adding one fuel station per day - Business Standard
item.description:
Nayara Energy to Expand Retail Network by Adding One Fuel Station Per Day

Publication Date: Sunday

Source: Business Standard

Nayara Energy, India's largest private fuel retailer, plans to add 400 petrol pumps this year to expand its retail network across various states.

  • Nayara Energy currently has over 6,500 retail outlets across India.
  • The company is focusing on states like Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, and Rajasthan for its expansion.
  • Nayara Energy recently revamped its dealer programme to attract new dealers and boost local entrepreneurship.
  • The company operates a large refinery at Vadinar, Gujarat, with a capacity of 20 million tonnes per year.
  • Recently, Nayara entered the petrochemicals sector with a new polypropylene plant.
  • CEO Alessandro des Dorides emphasized the importance of growing their network in upcoming towns for India's economy.
“As Nayara Energy grows its network, every new fuel station is an affirmative step contributing towards nation building by enabling mobility and enhancing connectivity within the underserved markets.”

Nayara Energy continues to focus on customer loyalty, innovation, and transparency while expanding its services and network.
